lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
dukePrint("Hello! What can I do for you, my highness?");
dukePrint(String.format("Unable to write to file at (%s)", FILE_PATH));
dukePrint("Bye! Hope to see you again soon my highness!");
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
dukePrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + taskList.get(taskList.size()-1).toString() +
"\nNow you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) {
dukePrint("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + task.toString() +
"\nNow you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks left in the list.");
dukePrint(String.format("List size is (%s). Please enter a valid input", taskListSize));
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
dukePrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + taskList.get(taskList.size()-1).toString() +
"\nNow you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
dukePrint("Here are the tasks in your list:");
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) {
dukePrint("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + "[" + task.getStatusIcon() + "] " + task.getTaskName());
dukePrint(String.format("List size is %s. Please enter a valid input.", taskListSize));
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
dukePrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + taskList.get(taskList.size()-1).toString() +
"\nNow you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
public static void handle(TaskList taskList, String input) {
dukePrint("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + "[" + task.getStatusIcon() + "] " + task.getTaskName());
dukePrint(String.format("List size is %s. Please enter a valid input.", taskListSize));
private final ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<Task>();
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, UNKNOWN
Task newEvent = new Event("this is a test ", "2022-08-31");
assertEquals("[E][ ] this is a test (at: Aug 31 2022)", newEvent.toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] this is a test (at: Aug 31 2022)", newEvent.toString());
Task newEvent = new Event("this is a test ", "2022-08-31");
assertEquals("[E][ ] this is a test (at: Aug 31 2022)", newTaskList.get(0).toString());
